intro: Ballota hispanica subsp. bullata, commonly known as the Spanish ballota or bullate ballota, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The subspecies bullata is distinguished by its more robust growth and slightly larger leaves compared to other subspecies of Ballota hispanica.
